meanings.definition: Causing degradation or reduction in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The degradative weather had damaged the old house beyond repair.
meanings.sent2: The degradative effects of time had worn down the once vibrant painting.
meanings.sent3: The degradative impact of the prank left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her degradative comments chipped away at his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The degradative nature of the virus made it a serious threat to public health.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the process of breaking down or decomposing substances.
meanings.sent1: The degradative enzymes helped in breaking down the food into nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The degradative process of composting turns organic waste into rich soil.
meanings.sent3: The degradative bacteria worked tirelessly to decompose the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent4: The degradative power of the acid slowly dissolved the metal.
meanings.sent5: The degradative action of the waves eroded the rocky shore over time.
